> Checkpoint is a free, open-source automated backup system for developers.
> It runs as a background daemon on macOS and Linux, creating hourly snapshots
> of your project files and databases with optional encrypted cloud sync.

## Product Overview
- Name: Checkpoint
- Version: 2.5.2
- License: Polyform Noncommercial 1.0.0 (free for personal use, commercial license available)
- Platforms: macOS, Linux
- Source: https://github.com/fluxcodestudio/Checkpoint
- Company: Fluxcode Studio LLC
- Website: https://checkpoint.fluxcode.studio

## Key Features
- Automated hourly backups running as a background daemon
- Native macOS menu bar dashboard (SwiftUI)
- Encrypted cloud sync via rclone (Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive, iCloud, S3)
- Database support: SQLite, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB (local, remote, Docker)
- File encryption at rest using age (https://github.com/FiloSottile/age)
- Version history with search and restore via fzf
- Docker container volume backup with auto-start
- Storage monitoring and automatic cleanup

## Installation
```bash
git clone https://github.com/fluxcodestudio/Checkpoint.git
cd Checkpoint && ./bin/install-global.sh
```

## Quick Start
```bash
# Run first backup in any project directory
backup-now

# Check status
checkpoint --status

# Search backup history
checkpoint search "filename"

# Restore a file
checkpoint restore
```
